result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Menore

records.addlTxt:
CLERK ERROR: 
Final pretrial date entered in error.  Date changed from 12/12 to 12/8.

Defendant Adam Menore appeared by video.  Attorney Michael s Winter appeared by video for Adam Menore.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Court is in receipt of defense counsel's request to adjourn pretrial conference.  Parties emailed new court date.
Received and Filed. Defense Request to Adjourn Pretrial Conference date.

Defendant Adam Menore appeared by video.  Attorney Michael s Winter appeared by video for Adam Menore.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel needs offer and discovery and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Adam Menore in court.  Attorney Michael s Winter in court for Adam Menore.  Attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Menore in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Winter submitted a letter informing the court that he will be out of town and would like an adjourned court date. Court granted the request. Defendant was given a reminder slip.
Case is adjourned to 8/29/2022, at 2:30 p.m. in OCCR out  of custody court.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 2:30p
